definition: male/Baron, lowest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/CL:個|个[ge4]
nature/character/property/quality/attribute/sexuality/sex/gender/suffix forming adjective from verb/suffix forming noun from adjective, corresponding to -ness or -ity/essence/CL:個|个[ge4]
to make into/to change into/-ization/to ... -ize/to transform/abbr. for 化學|化学[hua4 xue2]

sentences.english: To me masculinity is all my perception, and I think masculinity and feminity is very old-fashioned.
sentences.chinese: 但我认为探讨男性化还是女性化已经过时了。

sentences.english: These effects of excess androgens are called virilization and occur rarely.
sentences.chinese: 这些过多雄激素的影响即罕见的女性男性化。

sentences.english: In This paper discusses the fact that it is a trend accordance with the table tennis law that sportswoman has manlike technology.
sentences.chinese: 女子技术男性化是一个符合乒乓球运动规律的趋势。

sentences.english: The NRSV does not change masculine pronouns referring to God, however.
sentences.chinese: 在NRSV没有改变男性化的代名词，来指称上帝。

sentences.english: Abuse of male hormones can also lead to women appear masculine phenomenon.
sentences.chinese: 滥用雄性激素也可导致妇女出现男性化现象。

sentences.english: I like the playing style of Chan Yung-Jan. It's a little masculine, fast, and relentless.
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢詹咏然打球的风格，有点男性化，快且狠。

sentences.english: The faces were masculinised and feminised versions of the same features.
sentences.chinese: 每对脸是男性化和女性化版本的同一张脸。

sentences.english: Consequently,  the  more  testos- terone the body produces, the more  male-orientated the brain's behaviour will be.
sentences.chinese: 因此，男孩产生的睾酮越多，其大脑活动越是男性化。

sentences.english: Not all plantation work has been masculinized.
sentences.chinese: 种植园里的工作并非全是些男性化的工作。

sentences.english: "Testosterone is linked to masculine face shapes and it also affects behavior, " Little told LiveScience.
sentences.chinese: 睾丸酮与男性化脸型有关，并且还可影响行为。

sentences.english: Ideas about Masculine Protest led to a rift between Adler and Freud.
sentences.chinese: 思路男性化抗议导致阿德勒与弗洛伊德之间的裂痕。

sentences.english: When men are scared of a woman, they always accuse her of being mannish.
sentences.chinese: 当男人们畏惧一个女人，他们通常控诉她男性化。

sentences.english: They fear and despise the masculine.
sentences.chinese: 他们害怕并且鄙视男性化。

definition: not care about one's appearance (idiom)/slovenly in dress and manner
(of a person's manner or character) gentle and quiet
